data.title: Decent place for music but not the best.
data.text: Very limited menu for food but numerous drinks are available. Decent location for some music and often good bands play there like Blue Carpet Corner.

data.title: kool man!!!!!!!!!!!
data.text: really enjoyed the music...nice people working there. its like going into a time warp way people dress and look. we loved it. free music and just a great place. its all ages as well. we all have our own opinon.. check it out if you every in johnson city tennessee. then let us know what you think. GOD is wonderful, so if your lost in sin or need to come back, just ask him to come into your life. amen.

data.title: good jams and drinks
data.text: We didn't know what to expect, being an over 50 couple but the food was good and the beer was ample and cold.

data.title: Great Music and Beer
data.text: This place is a little bit of a hole in the wall but actually has a great outdoor patio and has live music inside. They have a great selection of local beer too. Mostly a college age crowd and has a really cool vibe.

data.title: Happy place to spend your day.
data.text: Nice people, great atmosphere, plenty of music, and good food too. My daughter turned me on to this establishment, and she too has great taste.

data.title: Go somewhere else for growlers
data.text:
I am a beer enthusiast who enjoys trying different beers, and noticed ACH has a good variety. I brought in my growler one day to get it filled, and was told that they only fill growlers that are sold at their store with their label on them. Not particularly pleased about having to buy a new growler, I did so anyways, and enjoyed the beer. 

Today I went back to get it filled again since I have friends coming over tonight to play cards. I went with my empty ACH growler and was told that they "may be out of lids". The cashier went to ask the manager sitting a few feet away, and returned saying she wasn't sure if they had any. I told her if they did that I would like Beer X. She proceeds to get my coffee made, and then fill up my growler, and returns without a lid and begins placing masking tape over the top (which is not sticking to the wet glass very well). I ask if they did not have lids, and she said "no, but I will tape it for you". I ask if that will be a problem driving around with it sloshing everywhere, and she recommended that I "put it between your legs" (nevermind the open container ticket I could get if I were to be pulled over!). I also tell her that it is lunchtime, and I have to return for work and was going to leave the growler in a cooler during the afternoon, and feel like it will be flat by tonight, and she replies "you should keep your lids in the future" and "we are ghetto around here". I have had growlers filled at many places, and each time a fresh lid has always been placed, as well as a plastic coating around the new lid that is heated so it seals it tight. I then had to take my taped growler to work and put in the refrigerator (talk about some weird looks from co-workers), and put a plastic bag around the top with rubber bands to try to seal it. The whole thing was absolutely ridiculous. I would have spoken to the manager if I didn't have to get back to work. Overall, I was made to feel at fault for not having an old lid.

Their coffee is decent (I always get the Red Eye -- 2 shots of espresso mixed with their house coffee), and their beer selection is nice, only if you enjoy your beer there and don't try to take it home. The atmosphere is very nice and chill, but the whole thing with the growlers is poorly managed, and should not be offered if they can't do it fairly and correctly. Go to Libation Station if you want a growler.

data.title: Dirty, Poor Food, Good Beer, Avg Coffee!
data.text: Do to the history of this place I had to stop while in Johnson City.  I was disapointed, no music during the hours we were there, Its a wanna be coffe shop however I didnt see a single person besides me with coffee everyone else was getting hammered (See college kid hangout).  After a couple of beer I decided they did have good beer.  My wife got the pasta salad and a sandwich both of which she said tated like they had been made the day before.  I dont recomend at all.  I had such high hopes but was thoroughly disapointed!

data.title: First stop in Johnson City
data.text:
I love coffee. I love coffee places. And I love relaxing and enjoying a cup of coffee, especially on a long road trip. This place is the first place where I stopped in Johnson City on my days trip of few states. 

There was live cello music on that afternoon. It was a soothing experience to sit there, browse internet while listening to the music. This place has a good sitting arrangements. Good for live musics like the one going on that day.

I will stop here again to relax and do my thing if I pass through this city.

data.title: What's all this hype about?
data.text: Seemed to have a great vibe, lots of beer choices and a nice seating area outside.  Food took probably an hour after ordering to get and we split a $8.95 pizza that maybe would have probably fed one person.  It was thin, hardly any sauce or cheese.  And, at an additional $.50 for topping...you are kidding?  Maybe 8 pieces of the topping was on the whole pizza.  I'd rather spend $1.50 and get a Totino's from the freezer....this may have even been a Totino's.  Restrooms were artsy with chalk and writing, but neglected to be cleaned or checked often because it was missing soap!  I will say this...the staff was really nice.

data.title: Atmosphere
data.text: Ok, the food is not spectacular and sometimes the service is a little slow but it's a great place to hang out and discuss whether or not 10 angels can dance on the head of a pin.  More beer (domestic and import) is sold than coffee, I think.  There are tables outside and in and there are usually only one or two free at any given time.  But ask to share with someone.  They will invite you to sit right down.  And, of course, musical performers can be found on many nights.  Often local but it could be absolutely anyone playing any kind of music.  Great place to just hang, people watch and make friends.

data.title: Irregular Regulars
data.text:
The Acoustic is an establishment, and I've been going monthly for the past two years. They have good coffee and great beers on tap with daily specials. The food is above-average for bar food--which is really what the "coffeehouse" is. The handmade calzones, soup, and fresh sandwiches are all very good. The beer is cold. They have a patio out front and a gravel backyard with tables and umbrellas. Smoking is not allowed inside the building.
Music is exceptionally eclectic--half of the musicians have talent (a number from ETSUs music and bluegrass programs perform there, as well as traveling groups), and the variety ranges from spoken word to freestyling rap with a laptop to acoustic blues to rock to bluegrass. They are active on Facebook, and post the music schedule regularly. Jim, the owner, is a great guy and a forgiving host, but I've never seen much trouble at the club. Locals of all stripes make this place their home-away-from-home.

data.title: Music, beer, coffee, food
data.text: Music nightly here.  Acoustic usually, not always though.  Sound levels are kept at a sane level.   Excellent selection of beers on tap.  Good coffee, cappucino, etc., but this is not a morning place.  It has bar type hours, opening in the afternoon.  Gets fairly crowded in the evenings especially when there's a popular performer or band playing.  The Acoustic Coffeehouse has carefully nurtured its look, from the colorful mural outdoors to the mismatched tables, to the art on the wall - it is not quite grunge, but it's definitely a blue jeans and sneakers kind of atmosphere.  There's an open mike night early in the week.  This is Johnson City's version of Nashville's Bluebird Lounge.
